comment: I don’t wanna sound like an asshole for any of the 1% that are gullible enough to believe her. But is it just me or is she exhibiting really “tweaker like behaviour” in this. The way she looks bored as shit at first and then like during the (clearly fake) crying the way she’s like frantic and shakey. It doesn’t look like a person who’s terrified or traumatised. I’ve seen people who are traumatised this just isn’t it the way she like wriggling  in her seat too. It’s very forced idk. Also for people saying it’s selfish to boycott Aquaman 2 bc of the countless other people who worked on it. I get that. But like if the film suffers bc of her (which I believe it will honestly) maybe the studio will FINALLY LISTEN. Bc like all they have to do is fire her. It’s not like they need her WB are a BILLION DOLLAR studio. And it’s not even like you have to make it known you’re gonna fire her. Audition actresses on the DL when you find a perfect replacement and it’s safe to drop Amber. DO IT. What’s she gonna do sue you?? I don’t think she’d dare considering I don’t see anyone other than WB hiring her or even looking in her direction at this point. No one good has her back. Aquaman 2 will suffer financially and they’ll realise she’s bad for business and drop her. Bc clearly the WB only care about money and also are likely afraid of her bc if she’s violent towards MEN AND WOMEN. Imagine what she’s probably like behind the scenes on a set. Don’t get me wrong all the production team who may suffer financially from the movie. I feel for them I really do. And it really isn’t their fault. It’s the studio execs and casting directors. There’s really no reason to keep her. But she’s very trigger happy with lawsuits and her history of violent behaviour. It wouldn’t shock me if they were worried about her having some kinda outburst. Like the way actresses are suing disney over streaming (rightfully so not complaining about them) but ambers very unhinged and narcissistic that if she’s fired she’ll see what scarjo and emma stone are doing and be like “huh maybe I should try that” Tbf tho I’d be interested to see how long she lasted in court since she’s pretty much the girl who cried wolf at this point

Karen : is a pejorative term for a middle- aged woman seeming to be entitled or demanding beyond the scope of what is normal. The term also refers to memes depicting white women who use their privilege to demand their own way.
Amber : is a pejorative term for a young woman seeming to be entitled or demanding beyond the scope of what is normal. The term also refers to memes depicting white women who use their privilege to demand their own way.
author: Floshi

comment:
She wasn't crying she was pretending to cry. When you actually lose it and start to cry, it's really hard to turn off. There wasn't any real emotion from her, it was completely fabricated. If she was truly recounting a traumatic event, in which the man she loved and married assaulted her, I'd imagine that she'd be a train wreck. Instead, she just tried to give the impression that she was a train wreck. Looks like acting to me... not good acting either. 

In my profession, I deal with battered spouses regularly. When they explain what happened, it's usually very messy. Many are in shock and can barely speak. Other times they are emotional. Regardless, it's usually pretty apparent that they went through some shit.

comment:
When someone is abused they know exactly what happened to them. There is no abuse victim that can’t recall the events, & says “um” that much, “idk what’s happening” 
“it’s hard to describe” unless they were intoxicated. That physical pain and violence against you is so traumatic it becomes stapled into your memory, it’s so clear & easy to remember, thats why most people can’t even bring themselves to talk about it. You remember every moment of it. She’s saying “um” so much because she’s trying to remember her story or make it up on the spot. This woman is disgusting & intensely convoluted. To every abuse victim I hope you still have courage to speak and reach out for help about what’s happening to you. There are ways of recognizing someone who is a liar. I’m sorry that this woman is pretending to go through something you are living with every day. Like it’s a big joke.

comment: As a woman who has gone through traumatic abuse I can say the way she describes what has happened to her seems very real and very genuine. when you go through a traumatic event it’s extremely hard to detach your emotional state of that event and explain it with precision and detail it is a trauma response you are reliving the moment every time.. it’s PTSD.. also for some people who experience constant abuse over a prolonged amount of time they’re brain blocks out a lot of the abuse it is a self defense mechanism and it takes a lot of practice and healing to be able to explain things calmly fluidly and in great detail. I feel bad for her. Not to say she wasn’t abusive as well, maybe she was? Idk? but to dismiss her abuse when no one else was there for their relationship no one lived it but those two Is absurd.

comment:
Okay, so I was serially sexually abused as a child, and I'll tell you which one of these people I sound like when I'm telling someone about it. I sound rambly, overly emotional about even the details that aren't painful. I don't like to tell anyone about it, specifically in detail, because I both don't like remembering the details because that brings all those emotions up, and also because a lot of them are murky and even repressed, and I worry they will think I'm lying.

Yes, repressing memories happens.

My abuse was in childhood, and the only reason I let myself finally believe it happened is because my abuser actually told me he did it, and apologized. This happened when we were both children, he was older but not old enough to realize how cruel his actions were and the longterm effect they would have (he was reenacting his own abuse at the hands of an adult, which is much more common than you might think, and the cause of a lot of child sexual abuse). At the worst parts? My memory completely cuts out. There's a very strong memory of the emotion and the lead-up, a few specific details, and the memory just before it cuts out is crystal clear, but then it just cuts off completely. I know there was more to the incident in question, because I was told so, but I have zero recollection of it, even if I try to recall. And I've learned later from psychology courses that it's actually quite common for the brain to do this to traumatic memories. More so for children, but for anyone who has a lot of stress hormones pumping through them. Noticing details is difficult, thinking straight is hard, in moments of extreme fight or flight. Of course you don't retain memories well. And your brain will get rid of some things purely as a defense mechanism. And for good reason. My mental illness was exacerbated so much by learning this information, to the point that I wish he had never told me at all. There were benefits- I understood things like why I had such bad vaginismus, or why I compulsively pulled away and felt intense anxiety whenever anyone touched my lower belly, why I had so much trouble sleeping well next to another person. But understanding them didn't make those symptoms go away all of a sudden. It made me feel less crazy- I suddenly had a reason for them. But if anything it made things worse, because now I think about it, and how my life could have been if it hadn't happened.

Anyway.

I don't know who's right and who's wrong in this particular fight, but from the tapes I have heard they both admitted there was repeated physical violence. I suspect both are at least slightly in the wrong, if not very much in the wrong. Depp may not even remember some of what he did, due to his well documented substance abuse, and genuinely believe he is totally in the right based on assumption of his own character being good and kind. He very well might be, when he is sober. But Amber doesn't read as a liar to me.

comment:
Amber: eyes darting about, over exaggerating movement, over articulation of hands, random pauses and stutters as iff on going corrections are being made, jumpy and on edge vibe demonstrated by her defensive demeanour. All suggest shes lying and try desperately to convince others of her truth, desperately trying to convince people of something she claims she doesnt want to have to do (the settlement). Her overall behaviour suggests someone who is quick to aggression under anxious circumstances. 
Jonny: calm composed demenor, eyes gently glanse to the same corner as a sogn of recollection, trying to supress anxious laughter brought on by traumatic memories and emotions, fear in his voice and no really desire to force the issue. This has every indication of a person who was abused, suffers with ptsd from the abuse and still loves the abuser enough to not want to put them through this.
No ones saying that he didnt hit her but its ridiculous that in this age of female empowerment people think its wrong that when a women is being abusive the man cannot hit her to defend himself but when a man abuses a women she is advised and cheated on for fighting back, surely we should either tell both men and women to fight to protect them selves or telling them both to lay down and “take it like a man”.

At 3:32 you see her eyeing her lawyer when she knows she has chosen the wrong words, and sure enough, he knows how to steer the boat.

Talking the talk in front of an attorney when previously you've played the "Ignorant victim card" Like, you know, this is so hard for her. Too precise to be consistent with how the rest of her testimony was like.
Personally, it was at 3:32 when I thought she was trying to save her boat.

comment: I've never experienced spousal abuse, but my dad got really violent with me and my sister when I was a kid; mom worked two jobs and he was a deadbeat leech alcoholic drug addict that tormented my sister and I until he ultimately took his own life. I don't remember much of my childhood before he died, but I can recall every detail down to what was on TV and the smell of his breath any time he would hit, slap, put a knife to my throat, etc. Her stuttering that she's trying to pass off as residual fear and panic isn't how that fucking works. That kind of shit either stays with you or is locked deep in your head and takes years to draw back out. She's disgustingly easy to read. What an absolute disgrace.

author: Wasan ibrahim

comment:
There’s a really easy way to know if someone’s lying, and if someone’s telling the truth while they’re telling stories. If the person tries to get eye contact with you for more than 4 seconds on average, it’s because they want, unconsciously, to look absolutely sure of what they’re saying.
The second thing is where the person is looking at while telling the story. You can’t keep eye contact for five minutes straight, because that would be awkward. So everyone’s gonna look away. And depending on which direction the person is looking in, you can easily tell if they are lying. 
If a person looks at the left side, or straight, they are most likely telling the truth. 
If a person looks at the right side, they are most likely lying, because the right side is called the « creativity zone ». 

Johnny was telling the truth and Amber was completely bullshitting.

comment:
3:34 "does not know what to say" Is a poor observation, not remembering the word third party and what a third party would do in a situation of panic isn't relevant to lying, especially not in this case where her lying is based in what johnny is doing. Not remembering the words and such in this example could actually benefit Heard seeing as you'd be pretty shaken up talking about your abuse, Thus making it real. She's prob bullshitting everything else seeing as she can't even tell them what john is or was doing rather well.

Adding to this I also liked the part where you write "disgusted?" As her lawyer is asking to take a break. That whole part of the video is incredibly interesting, her reaction is spectacularly weird. It's hard to describe seeing as so much is happening but it's as if she's rejoiced at first, being given a "lifeline" by the lawyer, prob cus she's at her ropes bullshitting away. then that strange head not whatever happens and as she realizes that she needs to prob take the lifeline and take a break she immediately falls back into the "sad puppy dog look". Also sad and "shaken" to the point where she needs a break but still manages to try and correct the court lady whoever, that she didn't answer FOR her lawyer, like come on.

Then we've got johnny and you got a bit carried away, scared of playing devils advocate?
So, He wasn't particularly concise at the part where your text said so, saying that she threw "a vodka bottle" then he talks about 2 being thrown. This could obviously be referring to the fact that only one bottle hit and injured him, but I feel like mentioning the fact that a pair were thrown is kind of important, and more jarring.
The dark humour can also be a type of manipulation where he's trying to be funny about the situation thus lightening the mood and appearing sincere. These are not my opinions of Johnny these are merely signals that can be interpreted in other ways.

All in all Johnnys is far better and more believeable. I truly get Gone Girl vibes from ambers part. She reminds me so much of Rosamund Pikes performance when the police are questioning her. It's kinda scary, also the very incohesive behaviour is a big tell.
Johnny didn't rely as much on the pure emotional empathy as Amber did, almost just dragging it out. Johnny got it over with, because who the fuck wants to talk more about such a nasty event?

comment:
Number 1 thing about telling the truth is you want to be clear, don’t want to be crying and even if you are you would be forcing it back, you wouldn’t want to be moving to much, distracts from the point you are trying to make (if there’s even a point at all) 
Amber has all the traits of a liar, I’ve grown up around sociopaths who lie better then that and no one ever believed any of the bullshit they said. Johnny is clear, calm, any movement he makes is straight forward and used perfectly to describe his side. Amber doesn’t deserve  the fucking sympathy she’s fishing for. I have severe high blood pressure, anxiety and under active thyroids and I manage to hold my shit better then she does, I’ve been in a similar situation to Johnny but with a family member, I know what that’s like to have to hold it together whilst explaining a horrible situation properly. Johnnys a good person, hope the best for him.

comment:
When someone has been abused in any way shape or form they don't tend to speak their stories out in rage (like Amber) and stutter and not remember.

It's a traumatising experience. If anything, no matter how much you age you will still remember that trauma like it was yesterday and you'd remember every pain from it. Johnny Depp manage to describe it clearly and openly but in a calm and a more closed up way. He had to use at least 3 coping mechanisms and he seemed confident in his words by not worrying about how the interviewers would look at him whereas with Amber she kept constantly looking and reassuring and raising her tone. Anyone can spot that.

Johnny rarely stutters and is very composed as he's retelling a story from memory that is true. When he does stutter, it's because what he's talking about is difficult as he's a domestic abuse survivor. His body language is more calm and composed, again because what he says is true and he doesn't need to use empty actions to elaborate his words. He tells a clear concise story from memory that he knows to be true and has proof. He doesn't need to act, but in various videos (not this one) you see he struggles to stay composed when around or talking to his abuser. Amber has absolutely no idea what she's saying. author: Boy

comment:
I honestly wasn't sure what to think of this entire case prior to seeing this. I was willing to think that they were both just toxic people in a bad relationship and guilty of multiple doings to one another. 

After seeing this, based on body language I totally believe Johnny's version of events in his story. He laughed about getting his finger chopped off, and yeah, it really is like that: that's how you respond to something so absurd happening to you, even when you're in pain. I'm the exact same way telling my stories from my past. It's not this big dramatic thing in your mind, it's just more confusing than anything, and once you accept it happened, you just tell it like it is. You're normally very reserved, and if you cry at all you feel kind of embarrassed and surprised more than anything and try to hide it. Johnny didn't need to, but still, it's a point.

Now Amber, I don't know. Jury's out on her. I'm not saying those are crocodile tears because I don't know her like that (though again, the point above: in my opinion she'd be trying to block or hide the tears if this were a real reaction), but it was very different body language and storytelling. The thing I have the most issue with and why she doesn't come off as well as Johnny does in this video, is that the gestures are WAY too big for this emotional a story. Like, if she's had to sit with a memory this long, there is normally some level of acceptance. Her trying to show how some things might have gone down, i.e the hair, is fine. It's the gestures in between that are an issue, gesturing when there is no reason to (I'd give her a pass if she was Italian or Mediterranean, because the culture there is like that, but no). 

If people are having flashbacks to a traumatic event, they're normally sitting still or at least their body language is far more reserved. When people exaggerate gestures it's because they're trying to emphasize a point under pressure. It's more a thing for other people. If you're having a genuine flashback, the last thing you would ever tend to do instinctively is gesture wildly. It just doesn't make sense.

comment: After Johnny's deposition I recognize the huge difference in pauses during describing what happened oppose to how Amber would pause and try to give her rehearsed response. Johnny's was more of a pause in disbelief it actually happened, like he was genuinely shocked he was having to repeat this in front of other adults. Amber's deposition looked and sounded so much more staged and coerced from her fake crying to deceptive over dramatization she narrated. Totally difference of pauses as Amber looked like she forgot most of her story and Johnny couldn't believe it actually happened.
author: CaSandra.c

comment: I dont think she paused because she  didn't know what to say next. If anything the whole ordeal shows us that she's smart so it is unlikely that she didn't prepare what she was going to say. I think she was trying to act like she was in shock ( as most victims of abuse are when the abuse occurs as well as when they are talking about it because they are reliving the incident). That's why she stutters and says things multiple times each time adding a new detail as to show that it was a blur when it happened and new information come to her as she goes. Overall her acting is not that terrible but her movements and sometimes facial expressions are overly exaggerated and theatric. What really doesn't sell it is when the whole thing climaxes she looks the interrogator right in the eye and moves her hands like a lawyer as if she's trying to sell the lie whereas is she truly was in shock she would have spaced out reliving the whole thing.

comment: I'm at 4:07 and I cannot believe how scripted her deposition became... She must have practiced that for weeks and still I could tell she's making it all up. She has rehearsed this before and the lack of genuine pain on her face is evident. Real domestic violence victims don't have a whine in their voice (like what happens often when someone is complaining), there is a genuine feeling felt of sadness and hurt from real women abused, but not here. She, here, Amber is WHINING ... Straight up.
author: CaSandra.c

comment: I unfortunately became a victim of a narcissist like this. And before you start commenting on this saying that this doesn’t happen often, you are wrong and you should be ashamed because this happens everyday. no one, including the victims, will speak up about this. I wish Johnny depp all the best and I hope he makes a full recovery, both emotionally and physically. comment:
This is for everyone who believes Amber or who supports/stand by her.
 We have past girlfriends and wives coming forward on Johnny's behalf telling everyone that he was nothing but respectful and kind to them and would never do anything to hurt any other woman intentionally, Amber has a known past of being abusive towards her old partners. Her lies also don't add up as I think she's trying to tell one lie but can't keep up with the rest and is confused with the narrative she's creating, she has also told police on the night of the incident where part Johnny's finger was severed off after she threw and bottle at him that he dragged her along the broken glass while she was naked, cutting and slicing her body as she tried to run away. This is false as not even a day after we see no marks on her body, and weeks after no scars from the 'cuts' from the glass the only scar we see is a small one on her body (I can't remember where I think it was either above the foot (shin) or on her neck), Amber has also been shown to have a record of faking injuries as well, which is a federal offense as she did show up with a bruise on her face which was allegedly made by Johnny, but then miraculously heals a day later, Johnny has the scars, the bruises, the pictures of the harm she has caused even weeks after it occurred, he looks scared to be with her in public or when she's near him, no abuser acts this way unless they are trying to portray the victim, which with the evidence against Amber seems very likely for her to do. The fact that she might be able to walk free with a slap on the wrist or a small sentence makes me disgusted on how society has portrayed the face of domestic abusers, for the women to be classified as the victims first, for men who's lives can be ruined with one false accusation. I know for a fact that Amber Heard fully acknowledges the injustice that many people face with this problem and she is abusing her power and title as a woman to destroy an innocent man's career and life, and for what? Money? Fame? The title of being a victim so she can advocate as a survivor, to be praised? These motives are twisted, and if it finally is proven that she did it, how is that going to affect the real victims, they will be silenced, rejected, excused, turned away from those who can help, and why is this going to happen, because some wannabe actress is losing her relevancy and needs attention from the media and the world. Think about who you are supporting and why.

comment:
A couple of things to notice: 
- Amber says "I don't know" and "I guess" a lot. This is usually a sign of deception because when you are trying to recreate an event that did not happen, you are not confident in what you are saying. People may see these phrases as a reaction to being flustered because she's remembering a "traumatic" event, but when you undergo a terrifying ordeal, you don't need to say "I don't know" because you remember it as clear as day. That's why it's called a traumatic event. Because it was traumatic, it should be crystal clear on the what, how, and when. 

- The captions typed out "tried to smile but can't" in Johnny Depp's deposition is not actually an attempt to smile to play it off. It's a sign of contempt. Contempt can oftentimes look like an attempt at a smile because the corner of the lips curl slightly upward. Contempt is always one corner of the lips lifting, never both sides. For example, when Johnny was describing how he thought he was protecting Amber by saying that he got his finger jammed in the accordion doors. His contempt may have been for himself for having covered for Amber or it was contempt for Amber for her having him lie for her about the incident. 

- Amber's deposition is full of over-exaggerated gestures that seem very unnecessary. It appears as if she is acting out the whole ordeal for the audience to make it seem more real and convincing to them. There is no need to over-exaggerate your gestures when you are explaining a true event because you know it to be true. A reason to actually demonstrate something would be because it would be difficult to explain verbally. None of what Amber is saying during her deposition is difficult to explain with just plain words. When you are trying to make yourself seem more convincing, you over-exaggerate. She may have noticed that her speech was very inconsistent so she covers it up with her gestures to make up for the inconsistency.

- Amber stutters a lot and makes a lot of illegitimate sounds and noises which may seem like she is just currently enthralled by her emotions as she explains what happens, but rising emotions don't come out as stutters or spurts of distressing sounds. These sounds are most likely an attempt to cover up her lack of wavering in the voice. Humans can often hear the difference between a fake and real wavering in the voice that is in emotional distress. Amber masks this poor attempt of wavering in the voice with a lot of distressing sounds. 

- if you look at 5:56 it's only there for a split second, but you will see Johnny start to pucker in his lips. Both corners of his lips are stretched. Not stretched out and up like a smile, but stretched out to the sides. Another split second later, you can start to see his gaze shift downward before it cuts to black. I believe this is an expression of regret when he says "my finger chopped off by this woman that I was married to". He is feeling regret over having married Amber.

P.S. Most of what I have described above are called micro-expressions as explored and studied by Paul Ekman. Paul Ekman is a well-established American Psychologist who pioneered the study of emotions and their relation to facial expressions and also has done extensive research in non-verbal communication. I have myself have done self-studies in his research because I am fascinated by this subject. I am not licensed nor a professional psychologist but I feel that the my own studies in this area of knowledge gives me enough warrant to make comment on this particular issue. I normally do not involve myself in celebrity gossip nor am I interested in it and mostly ignore most scandals that pop up because there are enough people out there who feed into the gossip themselves but when it came to this feud and controversial issue between Johnny and Amber, it became very hard to ignore seeing the insurmountable evidence against Amber but yet she is still being protected because of the stereotypical norm that women are in most cases the victim because of their gender. I am neither a fan nor disliked either of these actors and am the type of person who rather enjoy the movies produced rather than fan over the actors who are in them. This statement is just to show my own neutrality over this issue in case my observations above seemed one-sided. I went into this issue with a neutral state of opinion and my opinion was only swayed by supporting facts and evidence shown and given throughout the internet. I believe Amber Heard has some underlying narcissistic and manipulative traits and has a horribly bad habit of gaslighting those around her.

comment:
Amber’s perspective of her confession felt erratic, dramatic, and staged. While Johnny’s perspective of that confession felt more into heart, calm, and down to earth admitting truthful scenarios that make him seem what he actually is. He doesn’t provide the necessary distinguishing features of an individual trying to hide events that occurred or make himself seem like someone who committed those things. He establishes himself the bare truth to it all and takes his time with questions and remarks that had occurred. Amber seemingly seems as if she’s doing a role and publishing her perspective on what occurred in her eyes. But it just seems staged and practiced, it doesn’t feel as real as Johnny’s response on what did occur.


(Jesus Christ, I said “Occur” a lot)

CLASSIC give away that she was lying totally. 'what could be' is what your internal monologue would be saying, if you're making it up. Its like 'hmm now what could I say here.' comment:
I will say this, I'm on Johnny's side in this case. But the way people are attacking Amber and trying to armchair diagnose her testimony is not helpful. It is entirely plausible that a victim of abuse would stutter, lose their train of thought, forget about specifics.
She has given many conflicting accounts, as well as differing witness statements, oddly timed 911 calls with vague phrasing, pictures without valid metadata, perfect-looking TV appearances just a day after she claims horrific assault happened, etc etc. the list goes on. 

Dissecting these videos and over-interpreting is not helpful imo, ie "she doesn't remember" and "he tries to smile but can't" etc. as a running commentary - these are opinions and not facts. Let's stick to the facts. There are enough to show that she was lying.

comment:
Oh dear. The commentary of comments that shows along with this video are CLEARLY biased.
Let me put it to you another way, from someone who doesn't know either of them, or even like them.
Amber Heard told her 'story' as if it were actually being played out again: she's emotional, distressed, doesn't remember because in extremely crazy situations the brain does NOT have the ability to to process properly - it's called Trauma.
Jonnys 'story' however was told in a way as if he were describing a black and white film with no audio. I don't think he's smiling - I think he's smirking. This suggests something entirely different from 'happy.'
He is calculated and seems to remember every detail. Almost too well...

comment:
Amber has a criminal record of domestic violence and assault on a partner. A record that she deliberately tried to have covered up when she first met Johnny. Johnny has a criminal record too, but not of any incident of domestic violence or of assault on a partner (or any woman). Every wife, domestic partner, and girlfriend that Johnny has had over the past 35 years or so, either leapt to his defence when all this first came out, or chose not to back Amber when they easily could have done if they had any reason to. How many people have publicly backed Amber, except her family, lawyer, and current girlfriend? So the sackcloth-and-ashes beaten woman routine does not wash with me, nor I'd imagine with anyone who has a shred of perception for truth. 
I speak as someone who was violently abused in every way by a man for over 18 years, and as someone who was never believed. I have every reason to believe a woman's claim of abuse, IF it rings true and the evidence checks out. But the only thing Amber Heard sets ringing is my sociopath alarm bells. If there was domestic abuse going on between those two, and not what the courts would term 'mutual combat', then I know which one I'd bet on as the guilty party. 
I'll sum it up thusly: is it more likely that a. Amber bruised her own arm/used an unrelated bruise as 'evidence' (never witnessed by anybody else), or b. Johnny severed his own finger and had to have it surgically reattached in hospital (witnessed by a host of impartial medical staff)? Mull that one over.

comment:
It is disgusting how many people are abuse enablers. 🤦🏽‍♀️ Basically saying that we should believe her because she is a woman. As if there isn’t a such thing as false accusations. The amount of proof, people coming out and speaking, police interview in which someone who is very experienced with Domestic Abuse and Domestic Violence. Said that she checked both pent houses and there was no sign of wine bottles broken, on the floor, no destroyed furniture. No wounds on Amber’s face. She was able to see her face several times and examined her while they were there investigating. ANOTHER car was sent two weeks later. This is police documentation and they said that their findings were the EXACT same. No signs or proof that anything of what Amber said happened did happen. At all.

Not to mention she has an OBVIOUS abuse history meanwhile Johnny hasn’t. Not even with his ex wife in which he diverted to drinking. Something Amber says triggered his behavior. 🤦🏽‍♀️

How about the horrible ‘bruising she had’ one moment, but still decided to go onto a talk show in which showed her face. No signs of any swelling or anything. I know women who’ve falsely accused men of rape and abuse. This is a lie and I can see the bullshit from a mile away. 🤦🏽‍♀️

I’ve heard that making hand motions while talking it one of the biggest indicators of making up lies. It’s body language that tries emphasize your story and make someone seem like they are confident. 

Goes without saying Depp is more genuine as he looks genuinely tense when speaking

Mind you making some hand gestures when talking doesn’t always mean you’re lying, but Amber REALLY is very frequently making these gestures when speaking the entire interview which only makes her story more suspicious. I don’t believe a word shes said given everything I’ve seen INCLUDING this interview 

(I’ve learned this by watching to many crime interviews that break down body language)

comment: Something I've noticed when people who  have been abused for a long time is that they can be very calm when they are recounting what's been done to them. It's almost like a coping mechanism where they detach themselves from the feelings behind that situation because they need to in order to convince themselves to stay with their abuser. They calm themselves down, convince themselves that it is not a traumatic memory, in order to rationalize staying and to make themselves feel safe. My friend who was in an abusive relationship for 2 years would tell me about the things her bf would do or say to her while laughing, while I just sat listening in horror. Depp has that sense of disconnect, that awareness of what has happened but the detachment of trying to make jokes and smile at what should be a traumatic situation. Amber has none of that, and her lack of clarity does not ring true.

author: lovely zombie

comment: So interesting. Notice how she is replaying HIS movements (throwing the phone, grabbing her hair and yanking etc.) instead of what she was doing during this attack (grabbing her eye from being hit, holding her head/his hand etc.). You can see him replay his hand on the counter and the bottle flying past him, which are both from his perspective.  When we use our imagination, we can often see from many vantage points (like a movie) but when we recall a memory, there is only one vantage point. If you listen to her audio only, it’s convincing, but if you watch her, it’s... worth an A for effort?

author: Jazmin Ramirez

comment:
She was holding back the tears while being on display and having to recall a traumatic event! 

To all those saying where are the tears or acusing her of “fogetting” her story or whatever: sudden short term memory loss mid-speech is actually quite common in those with PTSD ! Sometimes in the middle of recalling a traumatic event at therapy I look exactly like that and in many instances I forget what question I was answering in the first place or even the beginning of my sentence at times! Which never normally happens to me! Only difference is that I’m allowed to take a moment and cry at therapy but she can’t do it in front of a judge and kept going! I admire her strengh! 

We should sympathize with ANY woman that had to endure abuse! But what most fail to grasp is that before it gets to a physical nature, emotional abuse and other forms as well can go undetected for years, thus leading to a heated moment where the worst in us comes out.

comment:
Let me see.....I was beaten by my ex for 22 years ago for the first time, and we have now been apart from each other for 17 years, we do co parent on our 2 kids. And we are buddies today, The abuse went on for 7 years of the 11 years relationship.
I remember vividly and would be able to recall and tell about the first time he hit me, where we were,  when,what he said, where he hit and what I said and did and my son being in the crib. I can say without tears in my eyes or knot in my throat today as I have dealt with it,seen my part og it and forgiven him many years ago, but I will never ever forget any details from that day and how afraid, young,naive and stupid I was. I even remember some of the song on the radio and how many times mhy son cried.
But Amber cannot remeber and stumblrs through her storytelling) wtf? Johnny is talking and closes hes eyes to look at the pictures that comes to his mind,it stiull hurts but hes telling it fluidly,while amber is yapping about piece of hair and dont even remember where she was punched or what he actually did? Johnny remeber how many bottles,and one bottles being bigger than the other. OFCAUSE HE IS TELLING THE TRUTH AND AMBER DOESNT EVEN KNOW WHAT OCCURED OR how you behve as a victim, for you dont have big hand gestures for yure so so exhausted and want it to end. 
I can only agree and karma,the truth will prevail,but I do hope Amber will get help, for she is very dysfunctional and she dont love herself and its very obvious. Great video, thanks very much! Sry for the typos,my laptop is stuck on danish

comment: i believe her. I was in a relationship with an abuser and he managed to psychologically abuse me to the point that I became a crazy person whilst being with him. Im not and never was the tipical victim of abuse..ill explain. i dont come from a family that has abuse in their background nor had I ever been before or after in ana abuse relationship. Im actually a very strong minded person and my partners including my actual partner now are the sweetest persons ... so its never been a pattern inn my life. however when I fell in love with this man it was straight after the death of my grani.. i was in a low moment and very vulnerable plus I was still heartbroken from my ex... at the beginning the relationship was nice but then he started to do those things..throwinga  phone at my face, smashing stuff, pushing me or hitting me, sometimes soft but its still hitting. then one night i defended myself and hit back, he punched me and started saying that if i called police Id be causing him trouble. i cried and felt embarrased to tell anyone... i cannot explain how and when it happened but he completeley managed to brainwash me..he worked me slowly into believing that i had issues. IMAGINe. he even sent me to a psychologist himself stating that i had insecurity and axiety disorders which I BELIEVED. my mom started to worry, my sister couldnt recognize me. then one day my best friend sends me an article about narcissist disorder and all suited him perfectly..by then i had fell out of love (luckily) so i broke up. we were living together so it took me a month to move out.. he then cried, stole my passwords to stalk me.. i then said to him id tell police and he played in  front of me a completely psychopathic scene of"how great he was going to speak out against me" cause his father is a police man and he said "I know how to talk". when I see johnny Depp talking I remeber my ex talking whilst when I see Amber I see myself ;( i was soooo damaged after he did this to me that I would to most ppl look like a dramatic bitch but it hurt me. It is still hurting when i think about it and ok.. it could be shes lying but I dont know how u guys can read this in her ways and just because jonny is so calm and u love him as an actor, he didnt do it for u automatically. people back then that didnt know me personally but knew im very outspoken and Im always down for fun would have said "ahhh.. shes crazy..of course shes lying, look at him so cute and beautiful, he wouldnt do such a thing" . my ex was a handsome dude that had a baby face and was loved by many coallegues. i never went to police cause i knew as a latin woman I wouldnt have had a big chance against the pretty white boy that all coallegues and even an ex gf would say hes the loveliest man "he would never do that, shes crazy" ,.. i walked away tho and since then Im again myself and happy and nope, I AM NOT A LIAR.

author: maggie

comment:
Not being able to remember what exactly happened is normal ,in this kind of situations, well when they actually happen, everything happens to quick and you are not emotionally stable, so missing details and forgetting things is normal . The case is that we are not meant to lie, our mind sees it as wrong so it makes our body react . There is not spacific reactions ,every person is different,  neither the same body language in every lier , but as more extreme the lies/our story is the more intense our body will react, this is why some so called actors  are overacting or being too dramatic too loud or too cringy,  they just don't believe the story they are selling us . For example will all have seen actors being advised that they should act more natural. If you compare how Amber talks about the events and how she talks about something completely diffrend it's like we are dealing with two diffrend persons . Her story is extremely fake so she can't control her body, she already wasn't a good actor but this is huger , she is not acting she is not trying to entertain us though we know it's just a role as in movies ,  she is trying to pass all this as true events and facts while she knows they aren't . This is why she looks like a sociopath, she can't control her body and face ,she can't look straight and her eyes are rolling and blinking ,her hands are moving all the time  and so her face ,she has no control over how her body reacts to her lies. 
Johnny from the other hand has nothing to hide , he is not trying desperate to convince that he is telling the truth ,he knows that what he speaks about is what happened and sometimes this is more than enough . Knowing that you are telling the truth  sets everything in the write way, your voice,face, moves everything in how you act represents that you are telling the truth .  One of the things we all know is that no matter how good he is at acting, in real life he just can't fake it ,he never was able to act differently than who he was.

comment:
Both Amber Heard's case and Biden's case have completely eradicated any progress that was made as a result of the MeToo and TimesUp movement.


The problem with MeToo and TimesUp is that they are very selective, witch victims they believe and what constitutes sexual misbahaviour... The cases of Biden and Kavanaugh are very emblematic for this... whereas Kavanaugh was (rightfully so) heavily scrutinised, Biden's case is dismissed... and the ample evidence in the case was just renamed (touchy-feely instead of serial groper and when the alleged victim gives more detail on the crime, they say she's changing her story).

comment:
Nobody here is qualified to make a judgment on whether either testimony is true or false. "Looking like bad improv" doesn't necessarily make it false and calm detailed descriptions wom't make it necessarily true.
Evidence (even circumstantial evidence) must be added to underscore or undermine a testimony. So far, (with the evidence, that is out in the public) it seems Johnny Depp's testimony is more credible.
